news_header: Sir David Attenborough reflects on the impact of wildlife broadcasting on conservation awareness as the BBC prepares to celebrate 90 years of broadcasting from Bristol.
news_text: Seventy years after starting his career, Sir David Attenborough emphasizes the significant role of wildlife programs in raising awareness about conservation issues. He notes that without broadcasting, the current state of the natural world would be much worse. As the BBC approaches its 90th anniversary in Bristol, Attenborough recalls the evolution of wildlife programming from capturing animals for zoos to highlighting ecological risks. He discusses the advancements in filming technology and the global fascination with natural history, asserting that the awareness of ecological damage is largely due to these broadcasts. Despite his fame, Attenborough remains humble about his contributions, attributing much of the success to the collaborative efforts of his team.
